title: Who is Bankim Brahmbhatt? Indian-origin CEO accused of $500m scam at BlackRock
content: BlackRock's private credit arm, HPS Investment Partners, alleges a multi-million-dollar fraud by Bankim Brahmbhatt's telecom firms. Lenders claim Brahmbhatt fabricated receivables used as collateral for over $500 million in loans. Brahmbhatt's companies have filed for bankruptcy, and he is reportedly in India.

title: Amid uptick of Christian nationalism, JD Vance-Usha marriage under scrutiny
content: Vice President JD Vance is facing divorce rumors after photos of him with Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika Kirk, went viral. Speculation intensified after Vance expressed hope his Hindu wife, Usha, would embrace Christianity, drawing criticism from Hindu groups and fueling far-right narratives about Christian nationalism ahead of a potential 2028 presidential run.

title: 'My age may be young, but ... ': Tejashwi shares how he plans to fulfill govt job promise; slams NDA
content: Tejashwi Yadav, INDIA bloc's Bihar CM candidate, pledges to transform the state into a job creation hub, ending migration. He highlights plans for factories, educational institutions, and healthcare, contrasting them with the NDA's perceived lack of vision for Bihar. Yadav dismisses 'jungle raj' fears, emphasizing economic justice and inclusive development.

title: Mokama murder case: JDU candidate Anant Singh arrested in connection with Jan Suraaj worker‚Äôs killing
content: Janata Dal (United) candidate Anant Singh was arrested by Patna Police in connection with the murder of Jan Suraaj Party worker Dularchand Yadav. The 75-year-old was shot and run over during a clash between rival groups while campaigning. The arrest follows evidence and eyewitness accounts, with accomplices also taken into custody.

title: 'Even Trump doesn't know ... ': Army chief flags fog of 'clueless' future
content: Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi addressed the complexities of future warfare, including cyber and space domains, while speaking in his hometown. He highlighted India's successful Operation Sindoor, emphasizing the targeting of terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan without harming civilians. Dwivedi also subtly criticized US President Donald Trump's claims of mediating India-Pakistan peace.

title: Alien object: Musk & Rogan discuss 3I/ATLAS heading toward Earth
content: Intriguing developments link SpaceX's Starshield network signals with Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting unusual characteristics. Discussed on The Joe Rogan Experience, the comet's nickel content sparked speculation about alien probes. Elon Musk offered terrestrial explanations but vowed to reveal alien evidence if found, emphatically denying any plans for suicide.

title: Louvre heist: 30-year-old woman charged with criminal conspiracy in Paris museum theft
content: A 38-year-old woman faces charges in the audacious Louvre jewel heist, arrested alongside four others. The suspect, from northern Paris, is accused of aiding organized theft and conspiracy. The October 19th robbery saw 88 million euros worth of royal treasures vanish in under eight minutes, with one piece later recovered damaged.

title: Government to issue bus safety checklist for RTOs after fire incidents
content: In response to recent bus fire tragedies, the government is mandating a safety checklist for RTOs to verify during vehicle renewals. This includes emergency exits, fire-resistant equipment, and passenger safety features. The move aims to enhance passenger safety and prevent future accidents, with stricter enforcement of the Bus Body Code now in effect for new buses.

title: ‚ÄòTwo words‚Äô wipe $29 billion off Mark Zuckerberg‚Äôs wealth, lowest in over two years on Billionaires Index
content: Mark Zuckerberg's net worth plummeted by $29.2 billion, dropping him to fifth on the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. This significant loss was triggered by Meta's substantial planned capital expenditures for AI infrastructure, including data center expansion. Investors expressed concern over the company's aggressive spending strategy and a $30 billion debt issuance.

title: Kerala free of extreme poverty, declares CM Pinarayi Vijayan; opposition calls it ‚Äòhoax‚Äô
content: Kerala has declared itself free of extreme poverty, becoming the first Indian state to achieve this milestone. Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan announced the feat, highlighting a meticulous process that identified and uplifted 64,006 families through micro-plans focusing on food, health, housing, and income. The government allocated significant funds for these initiatives.

title: IPL trade: RR, DC close to Samson, Tristan Stubbs swap; KKR press for KL Rahul‚Äî Exclusive
content: With Sanju Samson clear on leaving Rajasthan Royals, Delhi Capitals and Rajasthan Royals have been locked in negotiations with Tristan Stubbs set to go the other way. KL Rahul was also an option discussed but that was shut down rather quickly. Kolkata Knight Riders, meanwhile, are also pushing for the India batter but without a feasible swappable player.

title: Andhra temple stampede: Probe ordered as rush kills 9 devotees - top developments
content: A stampede at the Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple in Kasibugga, Srikakulam district, claimed the lives of at least nine devotees, including an adolescent boy, and injured several others. The tragedy occurred due to a railing collapse and subsequent panic among an estimated 15,000 devotees gathered for Ekadashi darshan at the newly inaugurated temple.

title: Bill Gates' warning on AI: Tons of investments will be 'dead ends'
content: Microsoft founder Bill Gates warns many AI investments will fail. He compares the current AI boom to the dot-com era.  A study shows 95% of companies see no return on AI investments.  Most AI tools boost individual work but lack business impact.  Many fail due to workflow issues and poor integration.

title: 52% of Gen Z decline being bosses: Leadership evolves; skills drive growth
content: Gen Z is redefining career success, with a significant portion opting out of middle management roles. A Robert Walters survey reveals 52% of Gen Z professionals prefer individual contributor paths, viewing management as high-stress and low-reward. This shift prompts organizations to explore alternative leadership models beyond traditional people management.

title: Taylor Swift worried about security as Travis Kelce shifts focus to new season
content: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about her security and privacy, wanting to avoid excessive media attention during Kansas City Chiefs games. While not asking for broadcasts to stop, she desires to maintain a lower profile. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce praised Swift's latest album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on his podcast, highlighting its success.

title: Stefon Diggs‚Äô alleged K‚Äôyanna Barber affair escalates as Cardi B expects baby
content: Rapper Cardi B is reportedly expecting twins with NFL player Stefon Diggs, but the couple faces controversy. Diggs is also accused of fathering twins with another woman, K‚Äôyanna Barber, a situation neither party has publicly addressed. This alleged infidelity has caused fan uproar as Cardi B continues to share her pregnancy publicly.

title: KSI vs Mams Taylor: What changed after Andrew Tate‚Äôs Misfits Boxing takeover
content: Misfits Boxing sees a major shake-up as KSI is out as CEO, replaced by Andrew Tate. Co-founder Mams Taylor cited KSI's inactivity as the reason, aiming for a more dynamic leadership. Tate's appointment has stirred controversy, with KSI expressing strong disapproval. The boxing promotion gears up for a significant event in Dubai under its new direction.

title: Leon Draisaitl slams refs over Mika Zibanejad penalty in Oilers OT loss
content: Leon Draisaitl expressed frustration with a controversial officiating call that resulted in a minor penalty for a high stick, which he felt should have been a double minor. Despite the disputed call, Draisaitl also acknowledged the Oilers' own issues with turnovers and puck management contributing to their overtime loss to the Rangers.

title: Jockey Tommie Jakes, 19, dies hours after final ride as racing world mourns
content: The horse racing community mourns jockey Tommie Jakes, 19, found dead at home. Jakes was a rising star, riding for top trainer George Boughey. He achieved his first win at 16. His sudden passing has sent shockwaves through the sport. Tributes pour in from jockeys and trainers. Police confirmed the death is not suspicious. A coroner's inquiry is underway.

title: Former India U-19 cricketer Rajesh Banik dies in accident; Tripura cricket mourns
content: Former India U-19 cricketer Rajesh Banik tragically passed away in a road accident at 40. A talented all-rounder for Tripura, Banik represented the state in numerous first-class, List A, and T20 matches. He also served as a selector for the U-16 team, leaving a significant mark on Tripura's cricket. His untimely demise has deeply saddened the cricketing fraternity.

title: Bihar polls: Opinion poll predicts close victory for NDA; Tejashwi most preferred CM face
content: An opinion poll by JVC Poll on Times Now predicts the JD(U)-led NDA will retain power in Bihar, securing 120-140 seats in the 243-member assembly. Tejashwi Yadav leads the popularity chart for CM, while the NDA is projected to get 41-43% vote share. Elections are scheduled for November 6 and 11.

title: Anthony Edwards out vs Hornets: Timberwolves share latest injury update
content: Anthony Edwards will miss another game for the Minnesota Timberwolves against the Charlotte Hornets due to a hamstring injury. His absence has highlighted the team's struggles with consistency and defensive lapses, despite a 2-3 record. Minnesota aims to find offensive balance and rely on Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo for leadership.

title: Trapped by duties: India‚Äôs workforce and toxic jobs; why quitting isn‚Äôt an option
content: A viral post reveals the silent struggle of Indian professionals enduring toxic bosses. Financial needs, family care, and education force many to stay, despite emotional harassment. This situation highlights a hidden crisis where employees face severe stress and burnout. Companies champion wellness, but reality shows a gap. Speaking out is a crucial first step towards dignity.

title: 'Trophy is here, just pick it up': IND stars back Harmanpreet‚Äôs team - watch
content: Harmanpreet Kaur and co. are set to play South Africa in the World Cup final on Sunday. With the final round the corner, top male cricketers and coach Gautam Gambhir have sent messages of support, urging the team to play fearlessly and bring the trophy home. This historic match marks India's third final appearance as they aim for their first ICC title.

title: 3 everyday foods that can help you live longer, according to science
content: Eating whole grains, nuts, and fruits and vegetables can help you live longer. These foods are packed with nutrients that protect against heart disease and diabetes. They also help manage cholesterol and blood pressure. Making these simple food choices a regular part of your diet can significantly boost your health and lifespan.

title: Stephen Curry playing tonight vs Pacers? Warriors issue key injury update
content: Stephen Curry is set to lead the Golden State Warriors against the injury-plagued Indiana Pacers on November 1, 2025. Despite missing key players, Curry's MVP-caliber play fuels the Warriors' Western Conference success. The Pacers, without star Tyrese Haliburton, face a significant challenge, hoping to find resilience against the experienced Warriors squad.

title: 'RJD to bring back jungle raj': BJP attacks on Tejashwi; cites Shahabuddin's son's nomination
content: The BJP has accused the RJD of reviving "baahubal" politics by fielding Mohammad Shahabuddin's son, Osama Shahab, from Siwan's Raghunathpur seat. BJP president JP Nadda warned of a return to "jungle raj," contrasting it with the development under Nitish Kumar and PM Modi. Voters are urged to support the NDA for stability and accelerated development.

title: Same entry and exit points, crowd surge: What led to deadly Andhra temple stampede - 10 key points
content: A stampede at the Venkateswara Swami Temple in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam claimed at least 10 lives and injured several others as a large crowd gathered for Ekadashi. The privately managed temple, not registered with the state endowments department, lacked official approvals, contributing to the chaos. Injured devotees are receiving treatment, with authorities fearing a rise in the death toll.

title: Caitlin Clark vs Paige Bueckers: Net worth and salary contract breakdown
content: Two new WNBA stars, Caitlin Clark and Paige Bueckers, are making waves. Clark has a higher net worth, largely due to significant endorsement deals. Bueckers also earns from sponsorships and a new basketball league. Both players are shaping the business of women's basketball, demonstrating their marketability on and off the court. Their financial journeys highlight their growing influence.

title: Heartbreak to hope: Harmanpreet's emotional words ahead of World Cup final
content: India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur expressed her team's readiness to finally clinch a global title, having experienced the pain of past defeats. Ahead of the Women's World Cup final against South Africa, she emphasised the team's hard work and collective spirit. This marks India's third final appearance, and they are determined to make this a 'special day' for the nation.

title: How much farting is normal per day? Top nutrition coach reveals 'healthy' number
content: Passing gas is natural, with 10 to 20 times daily considered normal. Exceeding this may signal digestive problems or dietary imbalances. Foods like beans and cruciferous vegetables, along with stress and certain medications, can increase gas. Eating slowly, staying hydrated, and exercising can help manage excess gas. Too little gas can also indicate issues with gut movement or enzyme activity, according to Ryan Fernando.

title: Language row: Karnataka CM says English, Hindi hurting children‚Äôs talent
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah accused the central government of neglecting Kannada and imposing Hindi, stating the state receives a "paltry amount" in return for its significant revenue contribution. He called for opposition to "anti-Kannada" elements and advocated for laws to make the mother tongue the medium of instruction in education, arguing English and Hindi weaken children's talent.

title: Ekadashi rush: Stampede breaks out at Venkateswara Swami temple in Andhra; 9 killed
content: A tragic stampede at the Venkateswara Swami Temple in Kasibugga claimed the lives of five devotees and injured several others on Saturday morning. The incident occurred during Ekadashi, a sacred Hindu observance, as thousands of devotees gathered. Authorities reportedly struggled to manage the immense crowd, leading to the fatal crush.

title: NMC redefines faculty eligibility: New rules reshape teaching; clarity on appointments
content: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has issued detailed clarifications on the Medical Institutions (Qualifications of Faculty) Regulations, 2025, effective June 30. The FAQs outline eligibility norms for Senior Consultants, Professors, Associate Professors, and Assistant Professors, addressing experience criteria, transitional provisions, and equivalence across specialties to ensure uniform, transparent, and merit-based faculty recruitment nationwide.

title: Jalen Hurts sparks mystery with cryptic ‚ÄòGod‚Äô costume at Eagles party
content: Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts embraced Halloween by dressing as Morgan Freeman's 'God' from the movie 'Bruce Almighty.'  Fans interpreted the costume as a nod to serving others and cleaning up the team's offensive struggles, with one fan humorously suggesting he was 'cleaning up Patullo's mess' due to the offense's ranking.

title: Whopping! Rohit‚Äôs men got Rs 125 cr - how much will IND women get for World Cup win?
content: The Indian women's cricket team is set to play South Africa in the ICC Women's ODI World Cup final. A victory could bring a historic win and a significant cash reward. The BCCI is considering a prize comparable to the men's team's earnings for the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph. This move aligns with the board's commitment to equal pay for male and female cricketers.

title: Mumbai hostage scare: Kids gagged, hands tied for hrs for 'scene‚Äô shoot; witnesses recount horror
content: A chilling hostage drama unfolded in Mumbai when a web series shoot turned real. Children, believing they were filming a scene, were held captive for hours by the director, Rohit Aarrya, who threatened them with a gun and rod. Prepared with flammable materials, Aarrya's plan was revealed after he pulled out weapons, leading to a tense standoff and eventual rescue.

title: Trump hails ‚Äògreat success‚Äô after talks with Xi ‚Äî But will it fix their economies?
content: US and China have reached a provisional trade deal, easing tariffs and pausing export curbs. While hailed as a success, the agreement may be too late for American soybean farmers and does little to address deeper economic woes in both nations.

title: Shah Rukh Khan calls John Cena a 'rock star'; WWE legend's heartfelt reply wins hearts
content: WWE legend John Cena expressed his gratitude to Shah Rukh Khan on social media after the Bollywood star called him a "rock star." Cena revealed that Khan's TED Talk profoundly influenced his life, and they had an emotional meeting at a Mumbai wedding where Cena shared this impact.

title: Bopanna announces retirement; bids adieu after 22-year career
content: Indian tennis icon Rohan Bopanna has bid adieu to professional tennis after a stellar 20-year career. His final match was at the Paris Masters. Bopanna etched his name in history this year as the oldest Grand Slam winner and World No. 1 in doubles. He expressed immense pride in representing India throughout his journey.

title: Top cardiologist reveals the best exercise to lower blood pressure naturally
content: The American Heart Association suggests that adults aim for 150 minutes of moderate‚Äëintensity aerobic activity each week, which can be broken down into five 30‚Äëminute sessions. A brisk walk, a bike ride or a swim, all count toward that goal. Dr. London stresses that weaving exercise into routines is the most reliable way to secure heart health, and keep blood pressure in check

title: Bomb scare: Hyderabad airport receives threat email; IndiGo flight diverted
content: Early Saturday morning, a bomb threat at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport caused alarm as an IndiGo flight was rerouted. The threat originated from an email asserting that operatives linked to the LTTE and ISI were plotting an attack involving nerve gas and improvised explosive devices.

title: Ravens deal ex-Pro Bowl CB Alexander to Eagles
content: The Eagles added cornerback depth on Saturday, acquiring former Pro Bowl CB Jaire Alexander and a 2027 seventh-round pick from the Ravens in exchange for a 2026 sixth-round pick.

title: Cristobal rues mistakes as Miami's CFP hopes dim
content: T.J. Harden scored on a 1-yard run in overtime, and SMU upset No. 10 Miami 26-20 on Saturday, handing the Hurricanes their second loss in three weeks and damaging the CFP hopes of a team that climbed to No. 2 in the country on the strength of a 5-0 start.

title: 'Proud' Manning returns, stars in Texas' victory
content: Texas quarterback Arch Manning returned from a concussion a week earlier to throw for 328 yards and three scores, including a 75-yard connection with Ryan Wingo on the game's first play, leading the No. 20 Longhorns over No. 9 Vanderbilt 34-31 Saturday.

title: Grizzlies suspend Morant for detrimental conduct
content: The Grizzlies suspended star point guard Ja Morant for one game because of conduct detrimental to the team.

title: Just Sayin: OSU's QB top Heisman fave after win
content: Ohio State quarterback Julian Sayin became the betting favorite for the Heisman Trophy (+175), according to ESPN BET, after another scintillating performance on Saturday afternoon, during the No. 1 Buckeyes' 38-14 victory over Penn State at Ohio Stadium.

title: Iowa St. TE Brahmer hospitalized, discharged
content: Iowa State tight end Benjamin Brahmer was carted off the field, taken to a local hospital and later discharged after sustaining a big hit late in Saturday's game against Arizona State.

title: Duke earns first win at Clemson since 1980
content: Darian Mensah completed a 2-point-play to Shamar Hagans as Duke stunned Clemson 46-45 on Saturday for its first win in Death Valley since 1980.

title: Dodgers to start Ohtani in G7; Jays go Scherzer
content: With everything on the line on Saturday night, the Los Angeles Dodgers will start Shohei Ohtani on short rest in Game 7.

title: üèà Why did the Dolphins keep Mike McDaniel?
content: Answering the key questions following the Dolphins' decision to part ways with Chris Grier and keep Mike McDaniel.

title: A Game 7 in the World Series? Why no other sport can match it
content: The Dodgers and Blue Jays have graced us with a winner-take-all Fall Classic finale -- something no other sport can match.

title: Everything you need to know ahead of winner-take-all finale
content: On Saturday, a champion will be crowned. Will it be an L.A. repeat or Toronto's first title in 32 years?

title: 'He can have a little peace': How Mookie Betts broke his slump in the biggest way
content: After a 3-for-23 start, Betts finally delivered with the clutch two-run hit that saved the Dodgers' season.

title: As it happened: Liverpool return to form vs. Villa, Man Utd draw
content: Re-live all of Saturday's soccer action across Europe, with Liverpool beating Villa, United sharing the points with Forest, and Bayern looking unstoppable in Germany.

title: Ready for NFL Week 9? We have sleepers, potential surprises, trends to watch and more
content: Will Christian McCaffrey and Sam Darnold go off? Can the Steelers upset the Colts? And could the Bills slow the Chiefs? Here's what to know for Week 9.

title: Five things to watch in J.J. McCarthy's return as Vikings' starting QB
content: It's time to see whether McCarthy can stay healthy and live up to the hype as the 2024 No. 10 draft pick.

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Two CB trades for the Eagles?
content: We're following every move before the 2025 NFL trade deadline, which passes at 4 p.m. ET on Nov. 4. Which players have changed teams?

title: Patrick Mahomes vs. Josh Allen, Round 10: AFC foes who are more similar than you would think
content: Another round of Patrick Mahomes vs. Josh Allen, including the matchup and where the two teams are in Week 9.

title: Buzz: Updates on Jayden Daniels, other returning QBs for Week 9
content: Stephania Bell provides updates on what to expect from Jayden Daniels and three other QBs expected to return this week.

title: Tottenham were devoid of ideas vs. Chelsea, and fans are turning on Thomas Frank
content: Tottenham looked feckless and devoid of ideas against Chelsea, such that coach Thomas Frank seems to be losing Spurs fans.

title: NBA Cup takeaways: Bulls tip off annual in-season competition with win over Knicks
content: The 2025 NBA Cup tipped off on Oct. 31. Here's everything you need to know about the third annual in-season tournament, including schedule and rule changes.

title: üé† Resetting the college football coaching carousel
content: Coaching changes are happening fast. With a month left in the season, here are six things to monitor.

title: üèà Governor: LSU AD won't select football coach
content: Louisiana Gov. Jeff Landry told reporters Wednesday that LSU athletic director Scott Woodward won't be involved in selecting the Tigers' new football coach in the wake of Brian Kelly's firing.

title: üèÄ Jordan: Load management never should happen
content: Michael Jordan didn't hold back on load management in the NBA, saying on NBC: "It shouldn't be needed, first and foremost."

title: ‚öæ Chapman: I'd rather retire than rejoin Yankees
content: Aroldis Chapman ripped the Yankees in a podcast, saying he would "retire on the spot" before playing for them ever again.

title: üëë The legend of Georgia Tech QB Haynes King
content: Stories about how the quarterback became one of the quirkiest, toughest and most insatiable players in college football.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Pats trade White to 49ers, Dugger to Steelers
content: The Patriots traded away two former defensive starters Tuesday night, sending defensive end Keion White to the 49ers and safety Kyle Dugger to the Steelers, sources told ESPN.

title: NYC Marathon pacers guide thousands of runners to glory
content: NYC Marathon pacers are the human metronomes keeping runners on track in the race's most challenging moments.

title: 17 men's college basketball teams that could win 30 games in 2025-26
content: History says a 30-win season could lead to a national title (see: Florida). Which teams could achieve the feat this season?

title: Storylines to watch in all 31 men's basketball conferences
content: Will UConn or St. John's win the Big East? Here are questions that could shape every league in 2025-26.

title: Briscoe, Byron, Hamlin, Larson: Who will be crowned NASCAR champion on Sunday?
content: Just four drivers are left standing in NASCAR's 2025 playoffs, and come Sunday afternoon in Phoenix, one of them will be crowned Cup Series champion.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United target Sporting's Hjulmand
content: Sporting CP midfielder Morten Hjulmand is on Manchester United's transfer shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 21 Dead, Over 30 Missing In Kenya Landslide: Interior Minister
content: At least 21 people died and more than 30 were still missing in a landslide on Saturday caused by heavy rains in western Kenya, the interior minister said.

title: 'Babies Will Starve': Kamala Harris Slams Trump's $300 Million Ballroom Plan
content: Kamala Harris unleashed a blistering tirade against President Donald Trump, blasting his plan to construct a $300 million ballroom at the White House, an expansion that would reportedly demolish the East Wing.

title: Raj Thackeray Joins Opposition Alliance In "March For Truth"
content: In a rare show of opposition unity, leaders of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) and the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) came together in Mumbai on Friday to protest alleged irregularities in the state's voter lists.

title: "Society Has Accepted ": RSS Leader On Mallikarjun Kharge's "Ban" Remark
content: The face-off between the Congress and the BJP's ideological mentor Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, has escalated with party chief Mallikarjun Kharge's comment that the organisation should be banned.

title: Woman Charged Over Louvre Museum Heist Tears Up In Court
content: A woman arrested this week along with four other suspects over the unprecedented jewel heist at the Louvre was charged and remanded in custody on Saturday.

title: PM Modi Unveils Projects Worth Rs 14,260 Crore In Chhattisgarh
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday inaugurated Chhattisgarh's 25th anniversary celebrations at the Rajat Mahotsav in Nava Raipur, with laying foundation stones for transformative projects worth over Rs 14,260 crore, spanning roads, energy, indu

title: Poll Body Orders Transfers After Death Of Jan Suraaj 'Supporter' In Bihar
content: The Election Commission has ordered the transfer of several administration ad police officers in Bihar following the murder of a man who was allegedly a supporter of Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party.

title: AIADMK Leader KA Sengottaiyan Slams EPS After Expulsion, Vows Legal Fight
content: A day after being expelled from the AIADMK, veteran leader and nine-time MLA KA Sengottaiyan hit back at party chief Edappadi K Palanisamy (EPS), calling the decision "illegal" and announcing that he would approach the court.

title: Venkateswara Swamy Temple Stampede Highlights: PM Modi Says He Is Pained By Andhra Stampede
content: Hundreds of devotees had gathered at the temple in Kashibugga on the occasion of 'Karthika Ekadashi'.

title: On Congress Chief M Kharge's RSS Ban Demand, Amit Shah's Counter
content: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh or RSS, which is in its centenary year, has given this country two very popular prime ministers, said Home Minister Amit Shah, countering Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge's demand to ban the organisation.

title: 2 Killed, 5 Injured In Collision Between School Van, SUV In Rajasthan
content: Two girls were killed, while five other students were injured after a private school van collided with an SUV here on Saturday morning, an official said.

title: 21-Year-Old UP Woman Dies By Suicide After Losing Rs 5,000 In Cyber Fraud
content: A 21-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide after falling victim to cyber fraud, police said on Saturday.

title: On Congress' Allegations, Amit Shah's "He's Abroad" Jibe At Rahul Gandhi
content: Tearing into the Opposition and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said attempts are being made to delegitimise democracy in India and allegations of 'vote theft' are made only when the BJP or its allies win an election.

title: GST Collections Rise 4.6% To Rs 1.96 Lakh Crore In October
content: Despite rate rationalisation, the Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections rose 4.6 per cent (year-on-year) in the festive month of October at about Rs 1.96 lakh crore, the official data showed on Saturday.

title: Man Lynched For Allegedly Eating 3 Boiled Eggs At Event In Bengal
content: A man was beaten to death by members of a local club in the Kamarpukur area of West Bengal's Hooghly district allegedly for eating three boiled eggs during a social gathering, the police said on Saturday.

title: Woman Kills 2 Children, Dies By Suicide In Karnataka
content: A woman allegedly killed her two children before dying by suicide in this district on Saturday morning, police said.

title: Day Not Far When India Will Be Free From Maoist Terror: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said the number of districts affected by Maoist terror has dwindled from 125 to just three in the last 11 years, and the day is not far when the country will be freed from the Maoist menace.

title: NDTV Bihar Power Play Highlights: Country Not A 'Dharamshala', Says Amit Shah On Voter List Revision
content: Bihar Powerplay, Assembly Election 2025 Highlights: The event began with Jan Suraaj chief Prashant Kishor making a bold prediction about his party's prospects in Bihar, saying it will either win fewer than 10 seats or sweep over 150.

title: Rs 2,000 Notes Worth Rs 5,817 Crore Still In Circulation: RBI
content: The high-value Rs 2,000 notes worth Rs 5,817 crore are still in circulation, according to the Reserve Bank data released on Saturday.

title: "Leave Violence, Join Mainstream": Surrendered Maoist Bhupathi To Comrades
content: Top Maoist Mallojula Venugopal Rao alias Bhupathi, who surrendered to Gadchiroli police on October 14, urged his active comrades to lay down arms and join the mainstream to work among the masses.

title: Maharashtra woman doctor's death: Jarange meets her kin, gets them to speak to CM Fadnavis, Dy CM
content: Mr. Jarange met her family in Kavadgaon in Wadwani tehsil and assured them of his support in their fight for justice

title: Gaming app for Arunachal children to know rights, sniff danger
content: Chief Minister Pema Khandu launched ‚ÄòChoo-Man-Tar‚Äô to sensitise parents and children about good touch and bad touch

title: Bihar JD(U) candidate Anant Singh arrested over Jan Suraaj worker's death in Mokama
content: The JD(U) candidate, who is contesting the election as a NDA nominee, was arrested by the police from his house in Mokama in the wee hours on Sunday

title: Francesca Orsini: Scholar of the east
content: The deportation of the literary historian, known for her seminal works on Hindi and Urdu, over ‚Äòviolation‚Äô of visa rules came both as surprise and shock for many

title: CPI(ML)-Liberation: Naxalbari to Vidhan Sabha
content: The former Naxalite outfit‚Äôs strategic shift to electoral politics yielded a credible 2020 Bihar performance and made it a key, ideologically driven partner in the INDIA bloc

title: Ernakulam records two dengue deaths in October
content: District registers a total of 533 dengue cases during the month, including 138 confirmed and 395 suspected cases; seven deaths reported in State

title: PM SHRI: Between funds and ideology
content: Kerala signed up for the Union government‚Äôs flagship school education scheme after three years of resistance only to pause the agreement amid strong opposition from a coalition partner of the ruling Left Democratic Front

title: Widening of ECR from Kottivakkam to Akkarai to be completed by Jan.
content: The 8.6-km stretch will be converted to six lanes; land acquisition issues that delayed the project have now been rectified, says Minister E.V. Velu

title: CPI(M) deploys ‚Äòred volunteers‚Äô to assist electors with SIR in West Bengal
content: Red volunteers rose to prominence during the Covid-19 pandemic and cyclone Amphan, which ravaged parts of the State in 2021

title: CHOs urge govt. to address long-pending demands
content: Their demands include removal of Facial Recognition System, payment of incentive arrears and rent, provision of transport allowance, and a fixed pay

title: ‚ÄòLeaders in States are unable to understand that good industrial environment cannot be created by suppressing labour‚Äô
content: All India Trade Union Congress general secretary Amarjeet Kaur says across the world, business has flourished where labour interest is protected

title: BC hostel inmate goes missing at sea; Minister directs officials to deploy Coast Guard teams to trace the victim
content: Bhanu Prasad, along with two inmates and another boy, skips school and goes to Muthyalammapalem Beach for a bath; while Bhanu Prasad has been swept away, fishermen rescue the other three

title: Vellore MP flags off low-floor buses for Vellore and Ranipet
content: TNSTC officials said that the new low-floor buses are beneficial especially for persons with disabilities as these buses have a kneeling facility for wheelchair ramps.

title: Chief Minister Stalin virtually inaugurates two ROBs near Katpadi
content: Originally given a nod in 2015, the two new bridges were jointly done by the Southern Railway and State Highways on a 50:50 fund basis under Railways Works Scheme 2015-16.

title: Bike thieves held in Arakkonam; nine two-wheelers recovered
content: Police said the duo told them that they target two-wheelers that are parked hurriedly by owners in public places.

title: AI-powered Kalika Deepa to help Karnataka students gain proficiency in maths, English, and Kannada
content: The State government has rolled out the Kalika Deepa programme to help students from class 4 to 6 of government schools to enhance competency in mathematics, English, and Kannada, with the help of Artificial Intelligence

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs paddy procurement during lean season not so lean anymore
content: According to¬†the data available on the Central Food Grains Procurement Portal, the lean season‚Äôs share of paddy was a little less than 16% four years go. During the September 2024 to August 2025 procurement year, it rose to around 40%

title: Lokesh says rush of devotees was unexpected
content: Nine out of 10 have visited the temple for the first time on Saturday. The local police, administration or the temple management had no idea that such a huge devotee turnout will be there, the Minister said

title: Lucknow enters UNESCO list as ‚ÄòCreative City of Gastronomy‚Äô
content: Global recognition celebrates the city‚Äôs centuries-old Awadhi cuisine, living food traditions and inclusive cultural heritage

title: CBI gets five-day remand of suspended Punjab DIG arrested on bribery charges
content: The CBI points out that Harcharan Singh Bhullar‚Äôs chats suggest a pattern to influence judicial orders, decisions

title: Support pours in for protest against waste treatment plant
content: A meeting held at Koodathai in support of the protest was attended by about 40 participants representing seven Mahal committees, five parishes, and parent-teacher associations of three schools in the affected area

title: Kerala High Court launches legal glossary
content: The glossary is launched with the objective of ensuring clarity, accuracy, and uniformity in the use of legal terminology in Malayalam

title: Reach out to distressed farmers, Congress urges Uttar Pradesh CM
content: Opposition parties call for State-wide survey, financial assistance after reports of suicide by a farmer in Jhansi due to stress over unseasonal rain destroying crop

title: BRS and BJP have an adhesive bond: Revanth Reddy
content: The BRS while it was in power for 10 years had failed to tackle civic issues in areas such as Borabanda and today the same party claims it would bring about changes there, the CM said

title: We have brought in reforms to help the public, says Karnataka Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda
content: Revenue Minister Krishna Byregowda stated that the State Government would submit a memorandum to the Centre seeking funds to compensate the damage caused to public instructure due to rains

title: Former spokesperson blames BJP leadership for councillor‚Äôs suicide
content: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation councillor died by suicide in September this year, following a financial crisis at a cooperative society he had headed. Spokesperson M.S. Kumar says the society he had helmed too is struggling due to non-payment of dues by BJP leaders and workers

title: Foundation for semiconductor production unit laid in Bhubaneswar
content: Approved under the India Semiconductor Mission, the integrated facility is expected to be operational by 2027-28, and entails an investment of ‚Çπ2,067 crore

title: Vishnu Deo Sai: Bastar rising beyond its scars
content: Peace and development are returning to this remote tribal heartland, which was under the shadow of Maoist violence and isolation for decades

title: Bihar Assembly polls: CPI(M) issues manifesto, accuses NDA of running a ‚Äònegative campaign‚Äô
content: The NDA has been running a negative campaign while pointing fingers at the Opposition leaders, which is perhaps inevitable for them since they have nothing to showcase by way of achievements of the last two decades, says CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat

title: Government reserves 85% PG medical seats for Telangana students
content: Telangana students will now have access to 85% of these seats, while the remaining 15% will continue to be open to All-India candidates

title: Kerala‚Äôs extreme poverty-free status a realisation of the basic ideal of economic equality: Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Actor Mammootty, the chief guest, made his first public appearance after a gap of eight months following a break from acting to undergo medical treatment.

title: Tech advances have made healthcare accessible in remote villages, says APSCHE Chairman
content: Madhu Murthy highlights Dr. NTRUHS‚Äôs pioneering role in health education; says technological progress is transforming medical services and training across Andhra Pradesh

title: Study tour for top scorers in Kannada medium
content: Kannada medium students who have scored 625 out of 625 in the SSLC examination will be taken for study tour by Karnataka Bal Vikas Academy, Chairman of the Academy Sangamesh Babaleshwar has said.

title: With AI‚Äôs help, trees in Idukki college tell their tale
content: ‚ÄòVruksha Vedam‚Äô, an AI-powered project, launched in College of Applied Science at Kanthallur under which QR codes have been fixed on 80 trees. Visitors can access details of the trees, apart from poems and novels on them, by scanning QR codes

title: Amit Shah, Nitish Kumar warn of the return of ‚Äòjungle raj‚Äô with the RJD; Tejashwi pushes back
content: In a video address, the Union Minister recalled the notoriety of Sadhu Yadav, brother-in-law of RJD chief Lalu Prasad, during the previous RJD regime; Tejashwi Yadav hit out at the PM over a recent spate of killings in Bihar

title: Haryana CM releases ‚Çπ2,100 each to eligible women beneficiaries
content: Nayab Singh Saini says the Deen Dayal Lado Lakshmi scheme is aimed at promoting self-reliance and economic empowerment

title: Unusual cheque transactions lead to multiple arrests under ‚ÄòOp. Cy-Hunt‚Äô in Ernakulam¬†Rural
content: The rural police have nabbed 43 people, the highest number of arrests recorded as part of the drive, in raids conducted at 103 locations

title: Tirupati Collector clears air on reconstruction of Hathiramji Mutt
content: He urges Hathiramji Mutt Committee members not to believe the misconceptions being spread that the entire mutt will be demolished

title: IIT-Kanpur did Delhi cloud-seeding trial despite Met dept warning of ‚Äòno clouds‚Äô
content: India‚Äôs State governments have in the past employed private companies to seed clouds, when their regions faced drought; the results have been hit-and-miss.

title: Private professional colleges to close from November 3 and protest with one lakh staff on November 6
content: The managements said this was the last option before the colleges and urged the universities to postpone examinations under their jurisdiction as the colleges would be closed

title: Amaravati‚Äôs soil, air and water shaped my life, says former CJI
content: At VIT-AP convocation, Justice Ramana recalls his roots in Amaravati, hails farmers‚Äô peaceful struggle, and urges youth to uphold faith in democracy

title: Case against YC leader for allegedly attacking policemen at Perambra
content: Youth Congress State general secretary had reportedly gone to the station to visit the UDF workers who were taken into custody following the clash at Perambra on October 10

title: Thirunelli Ashram tribal children to be shifted to Aralam by November 10
content: The decision to relocate the tribal students to Aralam comes after PWD declared the girls‚Äô hostel building of Government Ashram High School, Thirunelli, unfit for habitation and recent reports about poor living condition at the school triggered a wave of protests.

title: 2 Air India pilots grounded for operating flights without mandatory licence requirements
content: a co-pilot and a senior captain have been taken off flying duty . the airline found they operated a flight each month with a lapsed ELP licence in one case . in the other, they did so without undergoing mandatory corrective training .

title: 'Had they informed ...': CM Naidu blames organisers for temple stampede; cites coordination lapse
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: Mokama murder: EC orders replacement of two officials; seeks action compliance report
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‚Äòprime‚Äô political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India‚Äôs neighbourhood. Read More

title: Wetzel: Louisiana Gov. made finding next LSU coach harder
content: the job of hiring a new coach will fall to a subcommittee set up by the school's 17-member Board of Supervisors . the job would fall to an interim athletic director verge Ausberry . if Landry empowers president Trump to make the selection, he'll be able to hire "the best football coach there is"

title: Man United get reality check as winning streak ends at Nottingham Forest
content: manchester united held to 2-2 draw by Nottingham Forest . ruben amorim went from candidate for the sack to manager of the month nominee . the portuguese coach bemoaned the loss of two valuable points .

title: Recruiting intel: Vandy coming for UGA's QB; top prospect in the middle of LSU's coaching change
content: college football teams take the field Saturday, a potentially hectic final month before the early signing period for the 2026 recruiting class . the temperature is set to rise as top uncommitted prospects and flip targets visit campuses over the final four weeks of the college football regular season .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 9
content: the playbook for week 9 kicks off with the Ravens at the Dolphins . the column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: Expert picks, best bets: Two win streaks on the line at UFC Fight Night
content: David Onama and Steve Garcia headline their first fight card inside the Octagon . onama enters the fight riding a four-fight winning streak . his most recent victory was a unanimous decision over Giga Chikadze in April .
